meanings.definition: To make a springing or bounding movement.
meanings.sent1: The frog boinged across the lily pads.
meanings.sent2: The ball boinged off the wall and back into the player's hand.
meanings.sent3: The kangaroo boinged happily through the meadow.
meanings.sent4: Her heart boinged with joy when she saw her surprise party.
meanings.sent5: The excited child boinged up and down with anticipation.

meanings.definition: To bounce or rebound with a springing motion.
meanings.sent1: The rubber ball boinged loudly on the hard floor.
meanings.sent2: The trampoline boinged as the kids jumped up and down.
meanings.sent3: The clown's red nose boinged comically during the performance.
meanings.sent4: His voice boinged off the walls of the empty room.
meanings.sent5: The basketball boinged off the rim and into the net.
